resumeModels.headline: Data Scientist - PhD in Computer Science
resumeModels.summary:
Entrepreneurial-minded geek with a combined experience of over 7 years in Data Science, Data Analysis, and Software Development. Shares a great passion for open source, and a strong desire to work in a team where I can implement and learn new skills to achieve the organization's objectives of innovation and growth.

Having developed an interest in technology and computers at an young age, I have learned to program while still in high school. Later, I graduated with a Bachelors degree in Information Technology (India), and completed my \textbf{Doctorate in Computer Science} at the University of Louisville, Kentucky.
	
After being introduced to the open source movement in 2003, I have taught myself a variety of skills, including UNIX/Linux programming with BASH, Java, Python, web development etc. I have developed an extensive experience in Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Combinatorial Optimization. I am also experienced in designing and developing technology architectures to facilitate intra-organizational collaboration projects.
	
Currently, I work as a Data Scientist at Foot Locker Inc. I have previously worked as an Assistive Technology Specialist at Western Kentucky University, where I have used various Machine Learning and analytical methodologies to improve the accessibility standards of WKU's electronic content.

• Business Intelligence reporting to communicate results to stakeholders using Tableau, PowerBI.
• Working knowledge of Database Creation and maintenance of Physical data models with Oracle, DB2 and SQL server databases as well as normalizing databases up to third form using SQL functions.
• Power user of python libraries including NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, Scikit-learn, statsmodels, Requests, Matplotlib, Plotly, Seaborn, NLTK, Tensorflow, Keras, SQLAlchemy, Flask.
• In-depth understanding of Enterprise Data Warehouse system, Dimensional Modeling using Facts, Dimensions, Star Schema & Snowflake Schema, and OLAP Cubes like MOLAP, ROLAP and HOLAP (hybrid).
